summary:

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 25 Starlink satellites to polar, low Earth orbit
summary: The Starlink 17-20 mission will be the seventh Starlink mission this year. Liftoff from pad 4E is scheduled for 7:38:20 a.m. PST (10:38:20 a.m. EST / 1538:20 UTC).

title: NASA and DOE to collaborate on lunar nuclear reactor development
summary:
NASA and the Department of Energy have agreed to work together on development of nuclear reactors for the moon as industry awaits the release of a final call for proposals.
The post NASA and DOE to collaborate on lunar nuclear reactor development appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: RFA Awarded ESA Flight Ticket Initiative Launch Contracts
summary:
German rocket builder Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA) has been awarded launch service contracts for two missions under the Flight Ticket Initiative. The Flight Ticket Initiative is a programme run jointly by the European Space Agency (ESA) and the European Union that provides subsidised launch opportunities for European companies and organisations on small launch vehicles. Under […]
The post RFA Awarded ESA Flight Ticket Initiative Launch Contracts appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA Sets Briefings for SpaceX Crew-12 Mission to Space Station
summary: NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. title: NASA Awards Global Modeling, Assimilation Support Contract
summary: NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agency’s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract with a maximum ordering value of approximately $84 million with a five-year period of performance […]

title: NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission
summary: NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II mission’s journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep space. title: I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert
summary: Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: During NASA’s Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. title: Red, Green Light Show
summary: A green and red aurora streams across Earth’s horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the image was captured. Also known as the […]
